intro: Papualthia mariannae, commonly known as the Mariana papua, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Guam. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, elliptical leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is listed as endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
